solution_line_template: Greg kept 1 granola bar for each of the 7 days of the week, so there were {total_bars} - {bars_kept_for_self} = <<{total_bars}-{bars_kept_for_self}={bars_after_keeping}>>{bars_after_keeping} bars left.
He traded {traded_to_pete} to his friend Pete, so there were {bars_after_keeping} - {traded_to_pete} = {bars_after_trading} bars left.

His {number_of_sisters} sisters split the rest evenly, so each got {bars_after_trading} / {number_of_sisters} = <<{bars_after_trading}/{number_of_sisters}={bars_per_sister}>>{bars_per_sister} granola bars.
